data.title: Busy Rockford Street is Closing For Reconstruction Until October
data.meta_description: Rockford's Whitman Street faces long-term closure for reconstruction project, driving motorists to seek alternative routes. City advises residents and businesses on detour options and access during construction period.
data.text:
Motorists in Rockford will have to find a new route beginning next week as a major roadway is set to close.

Road Closing as Reconstruction Project Continues

According to a press release from Rockford's City Engineer, a section of Whitman Street will close from Rockton Avenue to Kilburn Avenue for a reconstruction project that will keep the street closed for several months.

Traffic control and detour routes will be posted to safely guide motorists through the area while improvements are made as the closure will begin on Monday, August 12.

READ MORE: Illinois Law Allows Parents to Rollover College Money to IRA

Traveling East down Whitman Street the detour will be north on Kilburn Avenue, east on Auburn Street, south on Rockton Avenue, and then back to Whitman Street Eastbound.

If you're heading West on Whitman Street, the detour will take you north on Rockton Avenue, west on Auburn, south on Kilburn Avenue, and then back to Whitman (School Street) heading westbound.

Residents who live in the area of the Whitman Street closure will continue to have access to their homes, along with mail, deliveries, trash, and emergency services will not have any interruptions during the road reconstruction.

Businesses in the area will also remain open during road construction.

This project is being funded by the City of Rockford's 1% Infrastructure Sales Tax and consists of pavement removal and replacement, driveway approach removal and replacement, curb and gutter removal and replacement, storm sewer upgrades, traffic signal upgrades, and other improvements.

This section of Whitman Street is set to be completed by the end of October, according to the press release.
